activities.name: Villa Durazzo Pallavicini Gardens
activities.description: Visit this magnificent 19th-century garden in Nervi when spring flowers create a romantic landscape masterpiece with exotic plants and beautiful pathways.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings lush greenery, blooming flowers, and comfortable temperatures to explore this extensive historic garden.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online or at the entrance; combined tickets available with other Nervi attractions.

activities.name: Coastal Walking in Boccadasse
activities.description: Explore the charming fishing village of Boccadasse when spring wildflowers bloom along the coastal paths and the Mediterranean sparkles.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers ideal weather for coastal walks with blooming flowers and comfortable temperatures for exploring the colorful cliffside houses.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed; take Bus #15 or #17 from Genoa center for a 20-minute journey.

activities.name: Pesto alla Genovese Festival
activities.description: Experience Genoa's celebration of its most famous culinary export during the annual pesto festival in the historic center.
activities.seasonal_notes: This spring tradition celebrates the city's signature dish with tastings, demonstrations, and competitions in Piazza San Lorenzo.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required, but arrive early to sample the best pesto from local artisans and restaurants.

activities.name: Genoa International Boat Show
activities.description: Experience one of Europe's most important boat shows featuring luxury yachts, sailing vessels, and marine technology.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held annually in spring at the Porto Antico, this prestigious event showcases the latest in maritime innovation and luxury boating.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online well in advance through the official website; professional days are less crowded than public days.

activities.name: Spring Seafood Tasting
activities.description: Sample Genoa's finest seasonal seafood as new spring catches arrive at the Mercato Orientale and local trattorias.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings fresh catches like sea bream, red mullet, and spring vegetables to Genoa's best seafood restaurants.
activities.booking_tips: Self-guided tours are possible, but several companies offer guided seafood tours with market visits and tastings.

activities.name: Spring Day Trip to Camogli
activities.description: Visit this picturesque fishing village when wildflowers bloom and visibility is excellent for panoramic views of the Ligurian coast.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers ideal weather for exploring Camogli's colorful houses, historic church, and beautiful harbor.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed; take a train from Genoa's Piazza Principe station for a 30-minute journey.

activities.name: Mostra dell'Artigianato (Artisan Fair)
activities.description: Explore Italy's most important crafts fair showcasing artisanal products from throughout Italy and beyond.
activities.seasonal_notes: Typically held in late April/early May at the Fiera di Genova, this large fair celebrates Italy's finest artisanal traditions.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online in advance or at the entrance; weekdays are less crowded than weekends.

activities.name: Nervi Park in Bloom
activities.description: Visit this extensive public park when spring flowers create a colorful display along the coastal promenade.
activities.seasonal_notes: May and June are peak blooming months, offering a fragrant retreat with spectacular views of the Mediterranean.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; open year-round but best visited in late spring when flowers are at their peak.

activities.name: Wisteria at Villa Durazzo
activities.description: Marvel at the spectacular purple wisteria in the historic Villa Durazzo Pallavicini Gardens, one of Genoa's most Instagram-worthy spring sights.
activities.seasonal_notes: The famous wisteria typically blooms in April, creating a magical purple canopy along the garden's pergola.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online or at the entrance; combined tickets available with other Nervi attractions.

activities.name: Aperitivo at Porto Antico
activities.description: Enjoy pre-dinner drinks and snacks while taking in panoramic views of Genoa's historic harbor during sunset.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings offer extended daylight hours and warm temperatures perfect for outdoor drinks with harbor views.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early to secure a spot at the waterfront bars or bring your own picnic to enjoy on the harbor promenade.

activities.name: Estate Genovese Festival
activities.description: Experience Genoa's summer cultural program featuring outdoor concerts, cinema, dance performances, and art events throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: This summer-long festival transforms piazzas, cloisters, and parks into cultural venues from June through September.
activities.booking_tips: Check the official Estate Genovese website for the schedule; popular events may require advance booking.

activities.name: Cinema all'Aperto (Outdoor Cinema)
activities.description: Watch films under the stars in historic settings like Piazza San Lorenzo or the courtyard of Palazzo Ducale.
activities.seasonal_notes: Numerous outdoor cinema events run throughout summer, offering both Italian and international films, often in original language.
activities.booking_tips: Some screenings require advance tickets while others are free; bring a cushion for more comfort.

activities.name: Palio Marinaro (Maritime Regatta)
activities.description: Witness Genoa's historic maritime regatta, a traditional rowing competition between the city's historic neighborhoods.
activities.seasonal_notes: This traditional maritime sport is held during June, celebrating Genoa's seafaring heritage with colorful boats and local pride.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early to secure a good viewing spot along the harbor or at Porto Antico.

activities.name: Genoa Dance Festival
activities.description: Enjoy contemporary dance performances in the stunning cloister of San Lorenzo and other historic venues.
activities.seasonal_notes: Running from late June through July, this festival brings international dance companies to unique Genoese settings.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online in advance through the festival website.

activities.name: Beach Day at Boccadasse
activities.description: Escape the city heat with a day at this charming pebble beach, easily accessible by bus from Genoa center.
activities.seasonal_notes: The perfect summer respite from Genoa's heat, with a small pebble beach and excellent seafood restaurants nearby.
activities.booking_tips: Buses run regularly from Genoa center; arrive early to secure a good spot on the beach during peak season.

activities.name: Nervi Summer Festival
activities.description: Experience concerts and performances in the beautiful gardens and coastal settings of Nervi.
activities.seasonal_notes: The festival runs from June to August, offering classical music, jazz, and dance in spectacular coastal settings.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance; performances often sell out. Bring a light jacket as evenings can be cool by the sea.

activities.name: San Lorenzo Night
activities.description: Join Genoa's celebration of the Feast of San Lorenzo on August 10th, with local celebrations and stargazing for the night of shooting stars.
activities.seasonal_notes: This local celebration coincides with the Perseid meteor shower, known in Italy as 'the tears of San Lorenzo.'
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; join the celebrations in Piazza San Lorenzo and around the cathedral.

activities.name: Ferragosto Fireworks
activities.description: Experience the August 15th holiday (Ferragosto) celebrations with special events and evening fireworks displays over the harbor.
activities.seasonal_notes: This Italian national holiday sees Genoa at its quietest as locals leave for vacation, but the city organizes special events for tourists.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed; find a spot along the harbor or at Porto Antico for the best views of fireworks.

activities.name: Grape Harvest in Liguria
activities.description: Take a day trip to the Ligurian wine region for vineyard tours, tastings, and harvest celebrations.
activities.seasonal_notes: September and October are grape harvest months, when the countryside is alive with activity and vibrant fall colors.
activities.booking_tips: Book a guided tour from Genoa or rent a car; many wineries require reservations, especially during harvest season.

activities.name: Genoa Biennale
activities.description: Explore this international contemporary art exhibition showcasing artists from around the world in multiple disciplines.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in odd-numbered years during October at the historic Fiera di Genova, this event features thousands of works from international artists.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online or at the entrance; allow several hours to explore the extensive exhibitions.

activities.name: Truffle Season in Liguria
activities.description: Savor autumn's prized white truffles in Genoa's restaurants or take a truffle hunting tour in the nearby countryside.
activities.seasonal_notes: October through December is white truffle season, when this precious ingredient features prominently on Ligurian menus.
activities.booking_tips: Make reservations at restaurants featuring seasonal truffle menus; for truffle hunting excursions, book at least a week in advance.

activities.name: Autumn Exhibits at Palazzo Ducale
activities.description: Visit Genoa's premier exhibition space for contemporary and modern art shows that typically open in autumn.
activities.seasonal_notes: Fall brings major new exhibitions to this Renaissance palace turned modern art venue, often featuring internationally acclaimed artists.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online to avoid lines; check the website for special events and guided tours related to current exhibitions.

activities.name: Olive Harvest Experience
activities.description: Participate in the traditional olive harvest and oil pressing in the Ligurian countryside surrounding Genoa.
activities.seasonal_notes: Late October through November is olive harvesting season, with many farms offering visitor experiences and fresh oil tastings.
activities.booking_tips: Book a guided tour that includes transportation from Genoa, or rent a car to visit oil producers independently.

activities.name: Genoa Marathon
activities.description: Watch or participate in the annual Genoa Marathon, which takes runners past the city's most iconic monuments and along the coast.
activities.seasonal_notes: Usually held in late November, the marathon offers a unique way to experience Genoa's historic center when streets are closed to traffic.
activities.booking_tips: Register well in advance if participating; spectators can watch for free along the route.

activities.name: Football Match at Stadio Luigi Ferraris
activities.description: Experience the passion of Italian football by attending a Genoa CFC or Sampdoria match at their historic shared stadium.
activities.seasonal_notes: The football season is in full swing during autumn, with pleasant temperatures for outdoor matches.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets through the official Genoa CFC or Sampdoria websites or authorized vendors; bring ID as it's required to match the name on your ticket.

activities.name: Autumn in Villa Durazzo Gardens
activities.description: Explore the historic gardens when fall colors transform this romantic landscape.
activities.seasonal_notes: October and November bring golden colors to the deciduous plants, creating a magical autumn atmosphere.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online or at the entrance; morning visits offer the best light for photography.

activities.name: Genoa Chocolate Festival
activities.description: Indulge in fine chocolates from across Italy and Europe at this annual autumn festival.
activities.seasonal_notes: Usually held in October in Piazza San Lorenzo, this festival features artisanal chocolate makers with tastings and demonstrations.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; entrance is free but bring cash for purchasing chocolates from vendors.

activities.name: Christmas Markets in Genoa
activities.description: Experience the German-inspired Christmas market in Piazza San Lorenzo and the smaller Genoese markets throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Running from late November through Christmas, the markets are especially charming when illuminated at night.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; weekday visits are less crowded than weekends.

activities.name: G-Light Festival (Genoa Light Festival)
activities.description: Marvel at the artistic light projections that transform Genoa's monuments and harbor during the holiday season.
activities.seasonal_notes: Typically running from December 8th (Immaculate Conception) through Epiphany (January 6th), illuminating the city during the darkest month.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed; a self-guided walk along the harbor and through the historic center covers most installations.

activities.name: New Year's Eve Concert in Piazza San Lorenzo
activities.description: Welcome the New Year with live music and celebrations in Genoa's most famous square.
activities.seasonal_notes: The city organizes public celebrations with concerts, often with multiple music stages in different piazzas.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed for public celebrations; for restaurant dinners or club parties, reserve well in advance.

activities.name: Epiphany Celebration and Cavalcade of the Magi
activities.description: Experience the historic recreation of the Three Kings' procession through the center of Genoa on January 6th.
activities.seasonal_notes: This Renaissance-inspired procession features participants in period costumes, flag throwers, and musicians.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; find a spot along Via Garibaldi or in Piazza San Lorenzo for the best views.

activities.name: Winter Sales Shopping
activities.description: Take advantage of Italy's regulated winter sales season with significant discounts at Genoa's luxury boutiques and artisan shops.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter sales typically begin in early January and last about six weeks, offering substantial discounts on fashion and local products.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; shop early in the sale period for the best selection.

activities.name: Opera at Teatro Carlo Felice
activities.description: Attend a world-class opera performance during the winter season at Genoa's historic opera house.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter brings the main opera season with premier productions and internationally renowned performers.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online well in advance, especially for popular performances; dress code is generally formal.

activities.name: Hot Chocolate at Historic Cafés
activities.description: Warm up with Genoa's famous thick hot chocolate at historic establishments like Caffè degli Specchi or Caffè Rivoire.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is the perfect season to enjoy this rich Genoese specialty, served with whipped cream and often accompanied by pastries.
activities.booking_tips: No reservations needed; counter service is less expensive than table service.

activities.name: Winter Day Trip to Portofino
activities.description: Visit the glamorous village of Portofino when tourist crowds are minimal and winter light casts a golden glow on its colorful harbor.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter offers a more authentic experience in this popular Ligurian destination, with local life more visible and minimal wait times at attractions.
activities.booking_tips: Buses run regularly from Genoa's bus station; no advance booking needed except for guided tours.

activities.name: Genoa Fashion Week
activities.description: Experience one of Italy's important fashion events, attracting fashion professionals and street style photographers to Genoa.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held twice yearly with the winter edition in January, bringing fashion energy to the city during the low tourist season.
activities.booking_tips: Industry events require professional accreditation, but the street style scene around the fashion venues is free to observe.
